message: not sure the best way to handle this (I've just been deleting the spam comments in topics where I can)
how about giving group admins possibility to ban users from their groups?
Just started to get some spam users in groups recently.

@miikao yes! I think the best thing would be if admins can ban users and any member (not just admins) could flag spam. Maybe admins could even see who has been flagged a lot so they could decide if the user needs to be banned.

@leah sounds good. Would you have the messages from the banned users stay, be removed automatically (from the group from the user got banned) or have an option for the admins to decide? Afterall, there might be a lot of some offensive language or pictures which would be a hassle to remove manually, but if it's just spam, it might be good to leave it as an example.

@miikao Probably the craigslist flagging method would be the best where it would require some percentage of users to have flagged a message in order for it to be removed.  Perhaps with the group admins being able to specify a threshold or if they want to disable automatic removal.
